item.title: Use Visual Studio connect a remote project
item.description:
Description:
Use Visual Studio & server URL to connect a remote project.

  1. Click ‘View’ -> ‘Team Explorer’


  2. Team Explorer shows as following picture
    click the ‘Manage Connection’ button (the green button) in the top


  3. Enter your server URL, click ‘Add’
    after a while, all projects from the server which you have permission will show as below


  4. Choose a project you want to connect and click ‘Connect’ button in the bottom

  5. The project’s full URL will show as below
    Choose a folder which you want to save the code and click ‘clone’ to clone the project from remote to local

item.title: Git clone authentication failed
item.description:
Description:
Use “git clone my_repository_url” to clone a project form remote to local in Windows 10 Pro’s Terminal.

Result:
I’ve got an “Authentication failed” error.

Reason:
Git didn’t ask me input my username and password for this repository, just simply show failed error. And there is no credential details about this repository in windows credential manager.

There are many ways to solve this problem, I’ve try the following 2 methods:

  1. use github desktop to clone this project, it will auto pop-up a window remind you to input username and password. This method works for this problem.

  2. manually add git authentication to windows credential manager:
    open Credential Manager


click Windows Credentials



click ‘Add a Generic Credential’ in Generic Credentials
input your repository server url, username and password (Note: it is server url not full project url)



Important: add ‘git:’ before your server url, the final result should be like: git:http://your_server_url




After add this generic credential, you don’t have to input the username & password for all repostories form this server.

item.title: How to make the native scrollbar thinner in Google Chrome
item.description:
Most people known how to add a scrollbar to your pages when the content of an element is too big to fit in the specified area. So, I will just give a brief introduction to CSS overflow property. overflow property has the following values:

  • visible - Default. The overflow is not clipped. The content renders outside the element’s box
  • hidden - The overflow is clipped, and the rest of the content will be invisible
  • scroll - The overflow is clipped, and a scrollbar is added to see the rest of the content
  • auto - Similar to scroll, but it adds scrollbars only when necessary

Please note that: the overflow property only works for block elements with a specified height.

First and the easiest way to set a scrollbar’s width is to use scrollbar-width property. scrollbar-width is a property that controls the width or “thickness” of a scrollbar. scrollbar-width accepts the following values:

  • auto is the default value and will render the standard scrollbars for the user agent.
  • thin will tell the user agent to use thinner scrollbars, when applicable.
  • none will hide the scrollbar completely, without affecting the element’s scrollability.
  • <length> is being debated, but (if added) would be a maximum width of the scrollbar.

More details, please visit css-tricks. Please note that scrollbar-width supports higher version browser.

Following code show another way to set the scrollbar thinner in Google Chrome:

.your-class-name {
  height: 100%; 
  over-flow-y: scroll;

  &::-webkit-scrollbar {
    width: 2px;
  }
}

ps: if there is any mistake, please let me know.
